title: 2021 Summer Intern - Global Brand and Communications - Creative Services
requirements:
Program Overview

Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description

Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization.

Creative Services is responsible for creative development and strategy for Global Brand and support Business Unit's throughout the company with branding and design for print materials, events, digital assets and marketing collateral.

Qualifications
Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.
3.0+ GPA preferred
Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly
Graphic Design, Advertising, Exhibit Design or Illustrator major
Basic knowledge of layouts, typography, line composition, color, and other graphic design fundamentals
Experience using the Adobe Creative Cloud software including InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
Strong creative and analytical skills
Experience using animation software such as After Effects is a plus
Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors

A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Please Note: Where we encourage you to apply now, our 2021 summer internship interview process begins in December and will continue through April. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications

align.

Learn More About Fiserv

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

#FSINT

title: Intern, Lifestyle & Experiential Marketing
requirements:
Job Description

The Intern, Lifestyle & Experiential Marketing, will support in the planning and development of sponsorship and partnership platforms for brands and categories within the CBI portfolio. This position will spend their limited term with CBI focusing on ensuring the processes and communication is in place to ensure that best-in-class programs and processes are in place within the sponsorship portfolio; as determined by business and brand needs. The position will be relied upon to help support cross-functional planning – including Brand, Field Marketing, Trade Marketing, PR, Media and other key stakeholders – is executed seamlessly. They will support the Senior Manager, Lifestyle & Experiential Marketing on the sell-in and negotiation of partnerships based on the strategic frameworks. This will require a focus on long-term thinking and establishment of best-in-class programming, measurement and reporting tools; in conjunction with the Activation side of the team. This position will serve as a liaison and connection point across all Constellation Beer Division business units helping drive consistency of programming across brands and platform. The successful candidate will have the ability to consistently innovate, have a keen understanding of the consumer and develop methods and tools to maximize resources to develop strategic sponsorships.

Responsibilities
Acts as a thought leader, building strategic sponsorships and long-term brand platform, using consumer insights to build strategic platforms leveraging Talent, Partnership or other consumer passion points.
Supports the centralized program development process of National platforms (Sports, Music and Entertainment), ensuring program elements can be executed 360 (Retail, eComm, Media, Field, etc.).
Support Senior Manager in development of measurement, evaluation and valuation models across all current and potential partnerships – nationally, locally and across platform.
Responsible for one or two Action Learning Projects throughout the course of their internship – project may include Marketing Whitepapers, analysis of consumer trends and behaviors, recommendations for programs or platforms. Projects will be developed and executed in collaboration with the Intern’s manager
Supports Senior Manager, Lifestyle & Experiential, on sponsorship planning as needed for development of acquisition strategy, ROI analysis and best practice sharing.
Acts as support mechanism across national accounts working with National Trade Marketing team to facilitate leveraging marquee local properties.
Facilitates communication, best practice sharing and cohesive approach across key existing properties and new properties as opportunities emerge.
Seeks out and is informed of latest consumer engagement trends across social, experiential, venue technology, festival technology and music industries.
Supports negotiation processes as needed by department Senior Manager and Director
Reporting Relationship

Reports to Senior Manager, Lifestyle & Experiential.

Qualifications
Creative, enthusiastic self-starter with ability to multi-task and work well with others as a team
Currently studying for a career in brand marketing, sports or entertainment marketing, experiential marketing.
Understanding of, or willingness to learn, brand strategy and how to implement it across various consumer touchpoints.
Passion Sponsorship and Events world – including sports, music, wine & food, and similar events
Proven success working in a cross functional team environment and driving processes with results across multiple stakeholders.
Experience working with internal cross-functional teams.
Proven track record of bringing creative new ideas and programs to keep marketing programming fresh and relevant, increasing ROI and driving measurable growth around business metrics (volume, share) and brand health metrics.
Ability to write a brand brief and deliver feedback to agencies in a succinct and efficient manner.
Strong budget management skills and the ability to effectively communicate forecasting and updates on a regular basis and as requested.
Strong communication skills across all forms of communication (written, presentation) with varying audiences (marketing/sales leadership, distributors, internal, field sales, field marketing sponsorship partners and agencies).
Ability to use consumer insights, syndicated information and other metrics to build business cases and analysis around sponsorship opportunities and ROI evaluation.
Proven success delegating roles and responsibilities to agency and field partners to successfully complete objectives.
Highly organized as well as ability to be highly flexible in a fast-paced atmosphere.
Ability and willingness to travel.

Physical Requirements/Other
Must be able to lift up to 25 lbs. on a regular basis
Must be able to travel by plane or train for long distance.
Must be able to work in a professional corporate office environment.
Must be able to stand, walk, sit; use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk and hear.
Must have close vision, distant vision, ability to adjust focus, peripheral and color vision.
Must be able sit and/or stand for long periods of time, and work on a computer for extended periods.
Location
Chicago, Illinois
Additional Locations

Job Type
Full time
Job Area
Internships
Equal Opportunity

Constellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).

title: Summer Intern
requirements: Looking for a junior or senior in college studying PR, Communications, Journalism or related field to help our consumer public relations firm with a wide range of responsibilities from building media lists to distributing calendar listings, writing, research, social media and more. Can be remote. For course credit. All details at https://breakaway-pr.com/summer-2021-internship/

title: MARKETING ASSOCIATE - Summer Intern 2021
requirements:
Employment Type

Part time

Shift

Description:

Loyola Medicine, treating the whole person with compassion—to "also treat the human spirit." The Marketing & Communications Department is looking for Marketing Associate Intern will assist on all stages of marketing campaigns including marketing, digital social media, media relations and internal communications for Loyola Health Systems.

The Intern will work full-time for a defined period during summer break 2021. Internship runs from May 18th through August 6th 2021

Location: Westchester, IL
In this role, the Marketing Associate Intern will collaborate with the Loyola Medicine Marketing and Communications team in executing key priorities, including marketing, digital and social media, media relations and internal communications. The associate will work closely with the marketing managers, social media, digital and media relations teams to develop, plan, implement and manage projects to achieve growth and communication goals for the health system.

Position Responsibilities
Drafts and implements communication and promotional plans for internal clients (i.e., pharmacy, safety, food service).
Manages consumer blog content calendar, production process, approvals and posting.
Drafts promotional materials, including consumer-facing and physician-facing promotional and marketing materials in conjunction with the content writer.
Drafts press releases and pitches stories to media in partnership with the media relations manager.
Produces social media and website content development, including copy writing and image selection under the direction of the content editor.
Produces internal communications content, including written copy, photography, etc., as needed.

Magis & Service Excellence Accountabilities
Responsible for consistently demonstrating our Magis values of Care, Concern, Respect and Cooperation through teamwork and effective communication in an effort to prevent and solve problems and to achieve quality outcomes, patient safety, customer satisfaction and a safe environment.
Responsible for developing and maintaining an environment of service excellence as outlined in the Service Excellence standards.

Minimum Required

Position Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree OR equivalent training acquired via work experience or education
Required: 1-2 years of previous job-related experience
Specify Degree(s): Marketing, Business or Communications

Preferred
Bachelor's Degree
3-5 years of previous job-related experience

Required

Computer Skills:
Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Outlook
Microsoft Power Point
Microsoft Project or Equivalent
Microsoft Word

Required Skills
Ability to analyze and interpret data
Ability to communicate verbally
Ability to deal calmly and courteously with people
Ability to deal with stressful situations
Ability to follow oral and written instructions and established procedures
Ability to function independently and manage own time and work tasks
Ability to maintain accuracy and consistency
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Ability to plan, coordinate and develop multiple projects
Ability to work as an effective team member
Other: Experience with marketing project management software, such as ActivCollab, Basecamp, etc.

Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

title: Social Media Marketing Intern
requirements:
We are looking for a social media and lead generation intern. If you have a passion for social media marketing, have proven lead generation results, and like to make things happen, please read on.

This position is an in-office position based in Phoenix. Aspire, www.poweredbyaspire.com, is known as a transformational-training company that delivers measurable performance improvement. This part-time position is responsible for driving new business leads in the area of training, leadership development, and consulting services.

If interested, you would meet the following qualifications:
Social media marketing: 2 years (Preferred)
Video editing software skills: (Required)
Lead generation marketing: 2 years (Preferred)

If you meet the criteria, please send a short, 3 minutes or less video on what you think the most important elements are in driving lead generation and social media impact along with your resume to jackieh@poweredbyaspire.com

Be a part of a fun work culture that is inspiring and values the gifts you have to offer as a team member. We sincerely look forward to meeting with you!

Other information:
· Position is currently offered as part-time (20 hours)
· Pay: $20.00 per hour

***Please no agencies apply. We are not considering third-party agencies/vendors or contractors.

COVID-19 considerations:
Common surfaces are cleaned and sanitized regularly. Professional cleaners at the office.

title: Photo Studio Intern
requirements:
Do you want to work in a cool, young, predominantly female-driven beauty company?

Are you passionate about the beauty industry?

Are you a self-learner who is looking for an amazing opportunity?

If this sounds like you, here’s your perfect job!

Sense Studio, the creative agency under Heat Makes Sense, is a full-service, in-house design and production team supporting all product development, marketing, and communications for amika, Eva NYC, and PYT. We are responsible for managing photo/video, print, digital, product/packaging design, visual merchandising and tradeshow projects with special focus on delivering a coherent and consistent visual brand message across any and all productions.

Sense Studio is seeking a photo intern to join our Brooklyn team. This position will work closely with our in-house photographer and creative department to help produce and execute photo and video shoots for our brands amika, Eva-NYC, and PYT. Our studio intern will have hands on experience working with a small team in a photo studio environment.

Sense Studio is an incredibly vibrant and fun workspace where enthusiasm for hair, beauty, and the creative process reign supreme. Our company ethos reflects a hardworking and down to earth mentality that truly shines through in all our staff. Possessing the ability to work hard under pressure in an outstandingly fun environment is key.

Suitable candidates will be available 3 days a week. This internship is a paid opportunity.

Responsibilities
Assist the photographer and producer in carrying out photo/video shoots for digital, social media, and print advertising
Maintain and manage cleanliness of studio and sets including floor and backdrops, equipment, wardrobe/props, and digital
Support the photographer as photo assistant and digital technician in all aspects to ensure efficiency in shoot production
Support client and craft services
Set up and maintain lighting based on directives from the photographer
Equipment pick up/drop off
Trouble shoot camera issues as needed
Keep record of lighting set ups
Support pre-production, production, and post workflows including prop sourcing, asset organization, and general assistance
Assist with post production processing (retouching, exporting, resizing)
Keywording for digital asset management through Webdam
Administrative and clerical duties such as expense reporting and transporting products


Qualifications
Photo/art or related bachelor’s degree or in the last year of pursuing a degree in photo/art related subjects
Strong proficiency with Mac OS, Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Suite, Canon cameras, Profoto lighting equipment, and Capture One Pro
Creative sensibility with an interest in photo/film, haircare, and beauty
A shared appreciation for our mantra: look good, feel good, do good!
Creative problem solver

Please feel free to share additional resources when applying - we are interested in seeing your blog, portfolio, Instagram, etc.

So why should you work with us?

Heat Makes Sense, Inc. is a fast-growing hair care/tool manufacturer based out of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, that’s been providing fun, performance-driven products and tools to professional stylists and consumers since 2009. Our products are carried by salon professionals and retailers worldwide. You’ve seen amika in Birchbox, Sephora and in your high-end salon (check amika out: loveamika.com) and you’ve seen Eva-NYC in Costco, Target and Urban Outfitters (check eva out: eva-nyc.com). We know we owe a lot of our success to our office culture and embracing a family-like work environment.

Unlike most other companies, we create everything in-house. Our product development team takes an idea for a tool or shampoo and tests a bunch of different versions (employee participation encouraged!). Next, it goes to our design team to create our unique packaging and marketing materials and then on to operations to get produced. From there, marketing, sales and ecommerce take the reins to get it out into the world. All along the way, we have our executives, accounting and HR/Admin departments to make sure the company itself is running smoothly (we still have hiccups but we’re getting there!) No matter what part of the company you work, you have an impact on the company as a whole, which inspires a team mentality.

“Work hard play hard” may be cliché but it’s really what we believe in. We have company events throughout the year, big and small: from going to the bar for happy hour to a field trip to Coney Island (we love our home of Brooklyn). We have an amazing rooftop where we BBQ during the summer and we have a Summer Friday event calendar.

Here are some quotes from real employees to tell you about who we are:
“Great products, great ideas, fun environment, great employees, capable and caring management, and endless opportunities for growth and development.”
“A warm and encouraging atmosphere.”
“Relationships between co-workers are extremely important here, which makes the overall experience of going to work very pleasant.”
“Hard work is recognized.”
“I feel lucky to be a part of a brand that is on an upward path—it is a very exciting time.”
“Lots of fun events where you spend time and get to know coworkers outside the office, overall my team felt like a family, and that’s rare in the workplace.”
“Super supportive management that really lets you have a voice and listens to your input and ideas.”
“What I like most about the company is the encouragements to grow your career. All of the brand presidents and most other people in leadership roles were here from the beginning and moved up to where they are now. Its inspiring and exciting - the company is truly serious about empowering and elevating people’s careers.”

Ready to apply?

Please click the link that will bring you to our careers page through Greenhouse. Submit a cover letter describing yourself and why you’d be the perfect fit along with your resume.

title: Marketing Intern
requirements:
High Alpha is looking for a Marketing Intern to join the marketing team this summer. If you're interested in being a part of a team that pushes the envelope to create unique and engaging experiences through brand, content, and digital marketing, this may be the role for you.
As a leading venture studio, we're in the business of creating world-class, high-growth SaaS companies and we hold our internal marketing strategy to the same world-class standard. We're a small team, so we'll need a summer marketing intern who is a voracious learner and has the desire to be continually challenged by learning new skills. As a member of our team, you'll be a part of the High Alpha network of experienced SaaS experts and operators and will be able to take full advantage of the High Alpha platform, events, and network.

About You
You're a college student studying business, marketing, communications, or a similar field looking to get marketing experience in the tech industry.
You are interested in building practical marketing experience and skills across a broad spectrum of content marketing, writing, email marketing, social media, and digital marketing.
You love writing, whether short-form content for Twitter and email marketing or long-form blog posts.
You have a passion for startups, technology, and marketing.
You are a quick learner and love learning new skills and expertise within digital and content marketing.
You're a self-starter that is comfortable working on projects that are new and unfamiliar.
You're flexible and comfortable with change and ambiguity involved in early-stage startups.
Why You'll Love It
You'll have the opportunity to build, launch, and work with the next generation of leading B2B SaaS companies.
You'll have a front-row seat to High Alpha's process for conceiving, launching, and scaling world-class B2B software companies.
You'll be part of a culture that emphasizes learning and growth.
You'll walk away with a tangible portfolio of marketing work that you can bring with you to future career opportunities.
You'll be challenged to think creatively, strategically, and tactically on a day-to-day basis.
What You'll Do
You will spend the majority of your time working with High Alpha's brand and content marketing projects, including social media monitoring and publishing, blog writing, content editing, email marketing copy, and website SEO.
This internship will be heavily focused around copywriting, blog writing, and content marketing.
You will assist in maintaining an editorial calendar and social media calendar.
You will work with the High Alpha Marketing Manager to carry out tactical execution of portfolio companies' marketing plans, including website updates, writing blogs and website content, developing content ebooks, writing advertising copy, and managing social media accounts.
You will report directly to the High Alpha Director of Marketing, but will often work with the Marketing Manager to execute on tactical responsibilities for marketing initiatives.
What We're Looking For
You're a college student studying business, marketing, communications, or a similar field.
Proficiency in Google Suite and Microsoft Office.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Examples of previous writing samples and work is a plus.
Entry-level experience working with Google Analytics, HubSpot, and Wordpress (or similar marketing technologies) is a plus.
What We Value
DREAMING BIG
We constantly challenge ourselves to push boundaries, defy conventional wisdom, and take smart risks by pursuing big opportunities hiding in plain sight.
MOVING FAST
We push ourselves and portfolio companies to build processes and systems that compress time, speed, and decision-making to produce results faster.
EXPECTING MORE
We demand the best from ourselves, our team, and our partners. We create the context for success by providing the appropriate resources, infrastructure, training, and mentorship required to win.
High Alpha is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Content Marketing Intern
requirements:
As a Digital Content Marketing Intern you will begin contributing real client work almost immediately; gaining valuable, direct client social media and internet marketing experience that few other internships will offer. Working as team with a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, creating, and writing blog, social media, email, and/or website content for clients in a wide variety of industries, but primarily the dog training and boarding industry. This is a 10-30 hour per week paid internship. The hours you work are flexible around your schedule and can be completed either remotely or in-office.

Responsibilities
Develop content ideas for multiple blogs, emails, social media, and websites.
Research, write, edit, and proof content according to content strategy and content calendar.
Adjust content to speak in the voice of various target audiences.
Work closely with a Graphic Designer and client to coordinate all projects.
Ensure consistency and adherence to brand standards.
Adhere to copyright and trademark laws.
Serve as a point-of-contact for clients.
Maintain client files on a cloud-shared server (Google Drive or Dropbox).

Requirements

title: US Internship: (Rotational) Growth Marketing
requirements:
Alation continues to hire for roles at various locations with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19 crisis. Everyone new to the Alation team, along with our current workforce, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

What You'll Do

A rotational internship across all marketing disciplines, including demand generation, marketing operations, product marketing, and communications. Example projects listed below:

Demand Generation
Learn digital marketing techniques and work on programs in paid and organic search, and account-based marketing.

Product Marketing

Marketing Operations
Learn best practice use of key B2B marketing technologies such as salesforce, Hubspot, Outreach, Bizible, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Sendoso, and many other best-practice tools and techniques.

title: Summer 2021 Intern - International Marketing
requirements:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.

Job Category
Intern

Job Details

Department Description

At Salesforce, our world-class marketers create and tell inspirational stories to people around the world. We develop messaging and positioning, go-to-market programs, campaigns, events, and sales enablement. We measure our success by our ability to develop creative and innovative marketing strategies and gain key audiences’ mindshare. Our team supports our AppExchange Partner Program, which helps ISVs, developers and entrepreneurs build apps on the Salesforce Platform. We help our partners market and sell their apps on AppExchange - the #1 enterprise cloud marketplace - and grow their businesses with world-class partner technology and resources.

Role Description

The International Marketing Intern, as a part of the AppExchange team, will support AppExchange marketing for our AMER and EMEA marketing teams, focusing on international marketing. This person will have two parts of their role.

First, the International Marketing Intern will oversee and assist with planning, developing, executing events for partners, customers, and prospects with a focus to measure, analyze, and report on results. Events are an integral part of Salesforce’s marketing and enablement strategy, especially as it relates to our partner ecosystem, and this is an exciting opportunity to be a key player across all functions of the AppExchange team.

Secondly, this International Marketing Intern will lead the promotion plan for some of our most important marketing assets including our podcast series, websites, and brand awareness campaigns in our international markets. Working closely with our sales team, this intern will spend time understanding the pain points of our target audience and providing relevant content to them at the right place and right time.

The International Marketing Intern will be motivated to build their experience within events and digital marketing. During the Summer, you will support the strategic execution of events and digital marketing — from small hands-on workshops to full-blown experiences at large industry conferences while gaining hands-on expertise in the world of digital marketing.

Your Impact
Define and understand event objectives and gain buy-in from stakeholders.
Manage pre and post-event planning meetings and communications.
Create briefing materials, defining roles, timelines, and resources.
Manage event logistics from overall strategy to onsite execution.
Leverage follow-up from events with marketing and Business Development Representative (BDR) teams.
Share the analysis and reporting on the success of the event.
Work to create our podcast series highlighting trailblazing entrepreneurs and promotion plan to reach our target audience in our international markets
Collaborate across multiple teams to understand how we can leverage current content and promote via our microsite
Working closely with our sales team, understanding the pain points of our target audience.

Minimum Requirements
Currently enrolled in a University degree (Bachelor/Master - not MBA), graduating in 2022 or 2023
Exposure to Marketing or Digital Marketing
Highly organized, detail-oriented with exceptional project and time management skills.
Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to manage expectations.
Understanding of the process of organizing an event — promotion, registration, onsite lead capture, and reporting
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and last-minute changes.
Fast and creative problem-solving abilities for both quick fixes and areas where larger strategic solutions are needed.
Comfortable working with teams across multiple departments and functions.
Strong desire to understand and contribute towards broader campaigns and overall strategy of regional marketing teams.

About Futureforce University Recruiting

Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining, and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company.

With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.

About Salesforce

Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.

Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being named one of the FORTUNE "100 Best Companies to Work For®" 2020 — 12 years in a row.

There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest. And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that’s so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company.

We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.

For Colorado-based roles: Minimum hourly rate of $ 20.76 . You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

title: Marketing, Content, and Communications (Intern)
requirements:
Join a leading fintech company that's democratizing finance for all.

Robinhood was founded on a simple idea: that our financial markets should be accessible to all. With customers at the heart of our decisions, Robinhood is lowering barriers, removing fees, and providing greater access to financial information. Together, we are building products and services that help create a financial system everyone can participate in.

We Are Proud Of The World Class Products And Company Culture We Continue To Build And Have Been Recognized As

Just as we focus on our customers, we also strive to create an inclusive environment where our employees can thrive and do impactful work.
A Great Place to Work
A CNBC Disruptor 50 in 2019 and 2020
A LinkedIn Top Startup in 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020

Robinhood is backed by leading investors that include DST Global, Index Ventures, NEA, Ribbit Capital, Thrive Capital, and Sequoia.

Check out life at Robinhood on The Muse!

About The Role

We are looking for our first ever Marketing, Content, and Communications Intern Team! As part of this team, you'll have the unique opportunity to work across a variety of functions supporting Robinhood's fast paced, exciting, and meaningful approach to how we present ourselves to the world. You'll gain exposure and experience across a wide array of responsibilities from creative & brand strategy, industry & external affairs, community building & social impact initiatives, and design and comms. You'll be supported by an incredible group of specialists to help you begin your journey as a marketing and communications professional and broaden your view of the industry. This is a full-time internship with two possible program dates: May 25 - August 13, 2021 and June 22 - September 10, 2021.

What You'll Do Day-to-day
Work with our marketing, content, and communications teams on the day to day operations of Robinhood's internal and external facing content and communications.
Learn how our marketing, comms, product, analytics, and partnerships teams collaborate to build comprehensive campaign launches and enhance Robinhood's reputation.
Understand how our marketing and comms approach thrives at the intersection of consumers, news media, policymakers, and the public.
Build out our overall marketing and communications strategy for a certain target audience.
Assist our rapidly growing fintech company in problem solving and ideating to drive our business forward.


Teams
Brand - The Brand Team brings together the brand look, deeds and feels to be the financial relationship that everyone trusts to be an investor.
Communications - The Communications Team protects and enhances Robinhood's reputation through communications with the media, employees and other key partners.
Content - The Content Team shapes messaging from end-to-end: we can introduce Robinhood to someone who's never used it before, guide every action they take in our app, offer tips as they're starting their financial journey, and provide clear solutions if they need help.
External Affairs & Community - External Affairs and Community's work expands why people turn to Robinhood: for our mission, value set, and the lasting, positive impact we have with people and communities nationwide. We lead engagements that develop and nourish meaningful relationships with external partners. Be it the Black or LatinX communities, paradigm shifters, students and everyday investors, we demonstrate how Robinhood empowers everyone.
Lifecycle Marketing - The Lifecycle Marketing Team delivers capabilities that enable relevant and effective communications that result in a better customer experience, while also boosting customer lifetime value.
Integrated Marketing (Performance Marketing) - The Integrated Marketing Team helps plan end to end marketing campaigns around major brand or product launches, working across teams to define the audience, objectives, creative and go-to-market channel plan.
Product Marketing Management (PMM) - Product Marketers champion the needs of the Robinhood customer from product development, to product go-to-market launch, and through product adoption.


About You
Currently enrolled in a full-time, degree-seeking program in marketing, communication, or equivalent experience
Eager to learn about new and emerging technologies
Naturally curious about how people behave, what drives them, what makes them feel empowered
Ability to thrive in a fast paced and virtual environment
Low ego and proven teammate who takes creative initiatives and works collaboratively
Self-starter and ambitious learner who is comfortable with ambiguity
Excellent judgment and communication skills with a strong attention to detail

We're looking for more growth-minded and collaborative people to be a part of our journey in democratizing finance for all. If you're ready to give 100% in helping us achieve our mission—we'd love to have you apply. At Robinhood, we're looking for people invigorated by our drive to change the world, not for those from name-brand schools with distinguished resumes. We strive to create a community within Robinhood that represents the views and communities of our consumers -- from all socioeconomic backgrounds and from every corner of the country. Robinhood values the diverse thought and perspective that our interns bring and are delighted to create a platform for their fresh, creative thoughts in this space.

Robinhood promotes diversity and provides equal opportunity for all applicants and employees. We are dedicated to building a company that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work (and work environment) will be for everyone. Additionally, Robinhood provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review Robinhood's Privacy Policy please click here.

title: Intern Opportunities for Undergraduate Students: Marketing (Summer 2022 Start Date)
requirements:
At Microsoft, we have some of the strongest consumer and enterprise products and services in the world used by billions of people, as well as an incredible diversity of businesses from incumbent to challenger brands, and across both established and emerging markets. With a depth and breadth of career opportunities, and the ability to make a worldwide impact, you can design a career path that is hard to match.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job. Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available marketing intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship position, you need to be enrolled full-time as a student majoring in an applicable field with at least one remaining semester.

Responsibilities

Marketing Communications Manager

You are able to center your work with larger goals in mind. You are adept at working with team members across business groups and agencies to deliver a global integrated marketing communication plan.

The Marketing Communication Manager embraces our company’s Marketing principles, is a Microsoft brand steward, and drives ongoing improvements in maximizing marketing spend and driving marketing efficiency, and marketing impact.

Key Responsibilities

As a marketing communications manager, you will manage annual marketing communications priorities and success metrics. You will direct priorities for events and media, public and analyst relations. You will oversee production and deployment of advertising and drive the strategy and execution of digital and social media. You will determine the optimal mix of engagement vehicles for your product, service, or geography. You'll need to be a strategic thinker to ensure execution, risks, and global alignment are optimal.

Partner/Channel Marketing Manager

As a Partner/Channel Marketing Manager you will shape the strategy and manage the execution of programs that drive partner profitability. Partner profitability programs accelerate partner cloud practice development by helping the partners build business plans, develop cloud offers, create go-to-market channels, form new business opportunities, increase partner satisfaction, and strengthen partner loyalty.

Key Responsibilities

This role connects internal and external stakeholders to develop and drive channel marketing plans. You will engage directly with partners to drive execution, hold partners accountable for meeting business results, and adapt plans and investments accordingly.
You own the partner ecosystem and channel strategy. We need creative, analytical, and broad thinkers who collaboratively engage with partners to identify and achieve mutually beneficial results. As needed, you will incubate new partner models and deliver a partner gap analysis. You own the partner campaign, program activity delivery, and sales pipeline support.

Product Marketing Manager

You are the key to global marketing. You determine marketing strategy for your area and communicate through marketing plans, product content, and internal and external evangelism.

The Product Marketing Manager understands, orchestrates, and influences campaigns and marketing activities, develops integrated marketing campaigns, and delivers product, solutions and customer campaign feedback to the business. An essential aspect of the role of the Product Marketing Manager is to align the content, timing and delivery of marketing messages and outreach to Microsoft’s customers and partners.

Key Responsibilities

You play a role throughout the marketing cycle: from positioning, messaging and storytelling to determining and orchestrating global launch plans and identifying market research needs. You also own monitoring our competition and building competitive positioning and response plans.

Business Planner

Grow the business and drive customer adoption with optimized pricing offers, licensing and packaging, leveraging actionable market intelligence to shape business priorities and direction. Collaborate with engineering, marketing, and finance to develop product monetization strategies aligned with our broader Microsoft business models.

ACE Rotation Program (Accelerated Connections and Experiences)

Current juniors will also be considered for a marketing internship in the ACE Rotation Program —a marketing rotation program that begins with an internship in one of the roles outlined above, and assuming you return full-time, continues with 2 distinct, 1-year rotations in different marketing roles at Microsoft. See the ACE Rotation Program page for more details.

Qualifications
Pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree at a 4yr accredited University (with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship).
Demonstrated interest in the continually evolving craft of marketing.
Proven aptitude for seeking creative solutions to multi-faceted problems.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment.
Ability to influence, inspire, and lead from any role.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Marketing and Go-to-Market Intern

Learn In is the first comprehensive talent-building platform helping companies solve for every barrier that stands between them and the future of work. We make upskilling easy and affordable for both employers and employees, and partner with the best in new-age training and financing providers.

requirements:
We are currently seeking an intern to support the Marketing department in several of our Harper imprints, including Harper, HarperBusiness, and Harper Wave. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the process from marketing research to media pitches.

The HarperCollins Summer Internship Program is a paid, remote, 10-week program which runs from June 7th through August 13th. All interns work 28 hours per week. title: Digital Marketing Internship
requirements:
Sony Corporation of America, located in New York, NY , is the U.S. headquarters of Sony Corporation, based in Tokyo, Japan. Sony's principal U.S. businesses include Sony Electronics Inc., Sony Mobile Communications (USA) Inc., Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., Sony Music Entertainment, and Sony/ATV Music Publishing LLC. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth. To learn more: www.sony.com .

Position Summary

We are looking for a Digital Marketing intern who will assist with and learn about Sony Corporation of America’s brand marketing process, from content ideation to media and channel planning through to measurement. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of the digital and social space, a passion for entertainment, along with a creative and performance driven mindset.

For the duration of the internship, the intern will own a project to showcase how Sony can better resonate with Gen Z in the U.S. The project will encompass all aspects of digital brand marketing inclusive of creative, and digital media. The intern will also provide day-to-day support for the Digital Marketing team, which will inform their final project.

Responsibilities
Maintenance – Assist with day-to-day account maintenance tasks inclusive of creative material distribution and billing. Capture and distribute meeting recap notes to internal team members, summarizing all deliverables and next steps. Monitor timing of deliverables to ensure POC’s are on track.
Activation – Maintain and review creative delivery documentation to ensure proper ad set-up in relation to the approved media plan. Maintain flowcharts and media plans to guarantee they are up to date after changes are made. Ensure proper legal documentation is signed and delivered to the agency prior to launch.
Reporting – Monitor weekly pacing reports from agencies to ensure campaigns are delivering in full and communicating when issues arise. Use learnings drawn from data to effectively make optimization recommendations during flight or for future.
Research & Present – Analyze “best-in class” digital marketing from competitors to inform project. Present findings on how Sony can better target Gen Z using both internal knowledge of the brand, as well as competitive.
Other tasks might include: Organic planning/publishing and copy creation

Qualifications
At least a Junior (based on accumulated credits) at a College/University
Graduate level students will be considered for this opportunity
Major in Marketing, Communications or Business Management preferred
Previous relevant experience is preferred in Digital Media
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint, Word and Excel
All candidates must be authorized to work in the US

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

title: Events Intern: Films Selection
company: Rose Foundation for Communities and the Environment
requirements: Are you moved by a good story?Do you think films are a powerful way to engage, educate, and inspire? Are you interested in gaining experience working in community events, the nonprofit field, and/or grassroots environmental movement?Do you want to be a part of a team pulling together an exciting online Film Fest event?If you answered yes then come work for the Rose Foundation as our Films Selection Events Intern for our 2021 Film Fest! Every year, we host a Film Fest to celebrate the power of grassroots activism and community resilience, to introduce new people to the Rose community, and to raise funds for our work. Our 2021 Film Fest will be held virtually during the month of September. As our Films Selection Intern, you will help us find compelling short films that showcase the spirit and power of grassroots activism; outreach to filmmakers to obtain permissions and work on co-marketing opportunities; lead our event marketing to grow our audience and advertise the films to our community; and help raise the profile of the Rose Foundations community empowerment and conservation initiatives. We will match your specific internship tasks and projects with your skills, background, and interests to create a meaningful and engaging experience.About the Rose Foundation for Communities and the EnvironmentFor over 25 years, the Rose Foundation has supported grassroots initiatives that inspire community action to protect the environment, community health, and peoples rights. Our community-based grantmaking approach has earned national recognition for building grassroots power for conservation and social justice causes, and our New Voices Are Rising youth leadership program trains Oakland high school students to step forward as the next generation of environmental justice leaders.Duties and ResponsibilitiesTasks will be flexible and assigned by thesupervisor, but initial scope will include:Research incredible films to screen at our 2021 Film Fest that align with our values: fostering environmental stewardship, building community, and demanding justice.Regularly present films to the event team for consideration. Shepherd the process of forming themed tracks and selecting films for each track.Outreach to filmmakers and community groups featured in films to acquire permissions and high quality video files.Acquire and organize stills and film marketing collateral to support the advertising of the Film Fest, specific films, and filmmakers.Seek out co-branding and co-marketing opportunities with filmmakers and nonprofits and community groups featured in films.Potential opportunity to help coordinate a filmmaker Q program componentKeep organized documentation, records, and files that are accessible to the event team and can be easily pulled and reviewed.Participate in weekly check-in meetings with supervisor and regular meetings with event team.Support the overall coordination of the virtual Film Fest as needed.Required Experience and Skills:Passion for films and storytelling and enthusiasm for our mission.Excellent interpersonal skills, in particular within verbal and email communication.Ability to reach out to external parties (e.g. filmmakers, community groups), pitch the opportunity to participate in the event, and negotiate terms in a professional and positive manner.Strong attention to detail. Highly organized and committed to meeting deadlines.Interest in diving into projects and learning new things.Ability to take direction, work independently, and work in a close-knit team.Experience with the Google Suite and Microsoft Office Suite (Word and Excel).Desired Experience and Skills:Experience coordinating and hosting events, in particular virtual and film-related events.Experience in marketing, advertising, and/or communications.Experience in graphic design, in particular digital design, and/or video editing/production.Position Terms, Compensation, and BenefitsThe Films Selection Intern is a 3-month position, classified as part-time, temporary, and non-exempt; with an hourly rate of $15.50 per hour. Expected work is 8-10 hours per week. Specificwork daysand hours will be agreed upon with the supervisor, generally within the hours of 9am - 5pm, Monday - Friday. Start and end dates will be determined upon hiring. As per the Rose Foundations Personnel Handbook, no benefits are associated with this position except those required by law.Supervisorand TeamThe Films Selection Intern is part of Roses Development and Communications Team, and is supervised by andreports to the Development Director.The Intern willwork closely with the Communications Associate and Executive Director, andmay also work with otherRosestaffmembers and event vendors depending on the task or project at hand.The Dev/Comm Team works closely on event planning and fundraising campaigns for the organization as a whole, our grantmaking initiatives, and our New Voices Are Rising program. These campaigns and events elevate our impact, share grantee stories from across the country, and tell the story of local Oakland youth leaders stepping up for environmental justice and climate resilience. We hire temporary staff and vendors as-needed for the Film Fest, and as we get closer to the event, its an all-hands-on-deck effort between staff, event vendors, board, and volunteers.Workplace ConsiderationsDuring the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and shelter-in-place, all Rose staff are working remotely. We will return to the office once it is safe to do so. The Films Selection Intern will also need to work remotely until all staff return to our Oakland office. The Rose Foundation will work with the hired candidate to ensure proper equipment setup and connectivity.The Intern is responsible for providing their own computer and internet connectivity, two items essential to the position.The Rose Foundation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Social Media Marketing Intern
requirements:
Rael is a VC-backed clean feminine care and skincare startup with a mission to empower women to make safe, healthy choices for their bodies. Unlike conventional pads and tampons, Rael products are non-irritating, hypoallergenic, chlorine-free, fragrance-free, and toxin-free - all without sacrificing quality, comfort or performance.
  The company was founded in 2017 by three women with distinct backgrounds — a journalist and bestselling author, a movie distributor at Disney with a Harvard MBA, and an architect-turned-art director. Once we launched our organic cotton pads on Amazon, we quickly became #1 brand in its organic pad and liner category. Now we offer not only organic feminine care products, but also clean, vegan skincare products including facial sheet masks, pimple patches, and skincare essentials. Rael products are available to purchase at GetRael.com, Target, Amazon, Walmart.com, Urban Outfitters, Walgreens, and more.
  Rael is for women, by women, and we’re growing rapidly to become a global brand. If you believe in our cause and are a self-starter and go-getter, consider joining us to be inspired and challenged every day and create something meaningful for women all around the globe!

Note: We’re currently working from home, but there may be occasions when you meet with the marketing team for collaboration. We'll take all the necessary precautions for Covid-19 if that needs to happen. 
   Job Description

What we seek:
Rael is seeking a dynamic and energetic college intern with a strong interest and passion for Social Media. The Social Media Intern will help with TikTok content creation, seeking and identifying key influencers, and supporting the Marketing team with everyday initiatives relating to Rael’s social channels. We would like you to be full of creative ideas and eager to learn about Social Media and Influencer Marketing.  The ideal candidate will have a positive attitude, a creative eye, and exceptional writing skills, all while being detail-oriented, results-driven, organized, and a dependable team player. This is an excellent opportunity to expand marketing skills in a collaborative and fast-paced working environment. Most importantly, we would like you to genuinely love our products, brand and have a passion for the cause we believe in.
  What you will do
●       Monitor TikTok trends and help conceptualize, pitch, and create multiple TikTok videos every week for Rael’s TikTok channel
●       Seek out key micro influencers to invite into Rael’s Affiliate Program and help grow our program with weekly outreach
●       Support our Marketing team with identifying key influencers for paid campaigns across Instagram and TikTok
●       Coordinate influencer sample requests with Rael’s warehouse
●       Research and propose social media tactics to deploy across social platforms
  Qualifications:
●       Current college sophomore, junior or senior studying Communication studies, Marketing, Advertising, or a related field
●       Passionate & knowledgeable about social media. Experience with Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, and/or TikTok is a huge plus
●       Strong content creator with experience making TikTok videos
●       Ability to film and edit video content from home (with Rael provided equipment)
●       High aesthetic bar to consistently delight our users and elevate our positioning
●       A true self-starter; unafraid to ask questions and clarify misunderstandings
●       Strong attention to detail
●       Comfortable working in the Google Suite of products: Gmail, Google Sheets, Google Docs.
●       Able to work independently, taking ownership & accountability over your work, while working in collaboration with and having access to team members who will provide advice and guidance
●       Committed to interning for at least 3 months (part-time)
●       Note: please include links to social media handles and/or any content you’ve created that you are proud of in your resume.

Preferred:
●       Comfortable being on camera for TikTok content

title: 2021 Summer Intern Program - Media & Publishing
requirements:
Sesame Workshop is the nonprofit educational organization behind Sesame Street which reaches 156 million children across more than 150 countries. The Workshop’s mission is to use the educational power of media to help children everywhere grow smarter, stronger, and kinder. Delivered through a variety of platforms, including television programs, digital experiences, books and community engagement, its research-based programs are tailored to the needs of the communities and countries they serve. For more information, visit us at www.sesameworkshop.org.

The Summer Internship Program will give undergrad students an opportunity to gain experience in a business environment. As a Sesame Workshop Intern you will learn from the best minds in the industry and contribute to our success. This is a unique opportunity to work with a dynamic group in an organization dedicated to the education of children. Our aim is to reach out to a diverse college population to increase awareness and interest in the areas of non-profit and children’s media. We believe having a workforce that reflects our diverse and culturally rich society is essential to our success.

PROGRAM DATES

Sesame’s 9-week Internship Program will run from Monday, June 7 through Friday, August 6, 2021.

PROGRAM SPECIFICS

Internships will be fully remote. Interns are paid $18 per hour and work 35-hour week.

Requirements
Qualified undergraduate candidates must be in good academic standing entering their junior or senior year in Fall 2021 at an accredited college or university with at least an overall 3.0 GPA.
Possess strong computer skills as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills
Available to work 35 hours a week.
Upon acceptance, you should be able to provide a copy of your transcript.

GUIDELINES FOR APPLYING

Apply online (instructions are below) by the application deadline March 19, 2021.

Application Materials Required
Current resume – Apply with your resume in MS Word or PDF format.
Include at the end of your resume, add another page then List the 3 Departments you are interested in in order of importance at the top and answer the following questions. For each question - Describe in 500 words or less:
Why are you choosing these departments to work in?
How does your background and experiences inform your decision to choose your major?
What are you hoping to gain from an internship with Sesame Workshop?
What else should we know about you and your candidacy?
Cover Letter – cut and paste your letter in the box reserved for the cover letter and you cover letter that should include the following on it:
Your School’s Name
Your Major/ Degree
Graduation Date


Internship Departments
Art, Design & Animation – The design aspects for all media vehicles including online, print and television shows.
Accounting & Finance – Manages the monetary side of all company transactions, ensures all entries are booked according to Generally Accepted Accounting Practice (GAAP), and reports on the financial performance of both the entire company and distinct projects within the organization. Accounting & Finance provides the necessary data that informs management about the fiscal health of the organization.
Content Research – Conducts formative and summative research, both quantitative and qualitative, with children and their caregivers to support concept development, planning, production and impact of our products and programs. Also provides information about a production’s particular curriculum area(s) i.e. mathematics, resilience, literacy, or science. Those Interested in Content Research must have experience working with young children, and prior experience in research with human subjects is preferred.
Creative Development – Develops new content and series to expand Sesame Workshop’s creative portfolio.
Digital Media Engineering – Cross-functional team within the Technology and Engineering Department that is responsible for building, maintaining, and monitoring digital products including websites, interactive media, and apps produced for domestic and international properties.
Digital Production - Production of all of the Workshop’s interactive products and platforms.
US Education – Defines, creates, and develops formal learning content (digital and print) for schools and education programs. Innovative content offerings include outcomes-based curricula in a range of content areas for children in Pre-K to Grade 3, professional development materials for educators, and family engagement supports.
Licensing – Creation and management contracts between the owner of a brand and a company or individual who wants to use the brand in association with a product, for an agreed period of time, within an agreed territory. As the brand owner, we are responsible for creating the design direction and the marketing umbrella that defines the brand's appeal.
Marketing – Promotes our business and drives sales of its products or services. They also research to identify target audiences.
Media & Publishing – Responsible for creating and distributing a wide array of media, including books, DVDs, e-books, apps, streaming media, music, and even museum exhibits.
Production – Creative content for Sesame Street, and other associated media. This includes ongoing creative development and long term planning of the show to drive forward the mission, increase child engagement and build the educational core.
International Production – Creative content for Sesame Workshop’s global presence. This includes ongoing creative development and long-term planning of local brand adaptions to drive forward the mission, increase child engagement, and build the educational core.
Production Management – Management of the planning, forecasting, and production costs at all stages of the production lifecycle.
Philanthropic Development – Responsible for generating revenue from both institutional (foundation, corporate, government) and individual donors to support all of Sesame’s social impact work domestically and around the world to reach the most vulnerable children with access to free content.
Public Relations – Strategic communication process that builds mutually beneficial relationships between organizations and the public.
Special Events – Project management to the creation and development of large scale events
International Social Impact – Responsible for growing Sesame Workshop’s global presence and initiating, implementing and strategically sustaining local brand adaptations to drive reach and impact. The team collaborates with a variety of international partners, stakeholders, and service providers to deliver educationally targeted, high-quality content through coalitions of local and global media, education, government, corporate, donor and civil society partners.
US Social Impact – Implements philanthropically funded community engagement initiatives that serve our nation’s vulnerable children and families. Based on fulfilling Sesame Workshop’s mission we created innovative, bilingual (English and Spanish), multiple media initiatives and resources that enrich children’s overall development through early learning basics, health and well-being and building resiliency skills to tackle challenging situations. There is a strong focus on localizing the implementation of these initiatives through key national and community organizational partnerships through individualized action plans and professional development.
Web – Work involved in developing a web site for the Internet non-design aspects of building web sites: writing markup and coding.


SELECTION OF INTERNS

Interns are selected on the basis of their academic standing, writing samples, participation in extracurricular activities, and previous work and/or internship experience. Incomplete applications or applicants that do not follow our directions will not be considered.

Interns may be interviewed by telephone or by video interviews. References may be requested.

Students accepted as summer interns will be notified on or before April 16th, 2021.

While we appreciate your interest in Sesame Workshop, only students under consideration will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Intern, Paid Social
requirements:
Job ID: 188479
Location Name: CA-FSC SF Off (0174)
Address: 525 Market St, 32nd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105, United States (US)
Job Type: Full Time
Position Type (Regular/Temporary): Intern/Trainee
Job Function: Internship

Position: Intern - Marketing, Paid Social

Location: Remote

Rate of Pay: $22/HR

Start Dates: May 24th or June 7th (10 week program)

Requirement: Rising Senior (graduating Spring/Summer 2022)

At Sephora, we offer a wide range of internship opportunities across our business. As part of our Emerging Talent Program, our internships focus on providing an inclusive and comprehensive experience that equips young professionals with the tools needed in order to align their passions with their work.

2021 Summer interns will be eligible to apply for a fulltime position in our newly created Rotational Management Program launching mid-2022 designed to support a diverse talent pipeline and build our future inclusive leaders. Applicants will be offered a role in one of the three participating functions of Marketing, Merchandising, Inventory Management and work in each of these areas learning our core business processes and store operations. More information on the Program experience and application process will be available later this year.

Your Role At Sephora

As an Intern, you will assist the Paid Social team in the management and optimization of Sephora’s Paid Social marketing program. The role is responsible for managing Paid Social operations that help support the activation and quality of the business. In addition, you will:
Manage Creative handoffs and QA
Get exposure to cross-functional teams. Sephora has a highly collaborative culture so you are encouraged and expected to work closely with other related teams across Media (Search, Display, Brand, Testing)
Support monthly billing process
Perform the facilitation of reporting requests and related engagements with Agency partners.
Research the latest beauty, skincare and wellness trends to inform content strategy
Assist in general reporting and technical audits
Develop, grow, and have fun!
Demonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.
Lead or assist on projects using a hands-on approach
Learn from the best in the industry by interacting with a dynamic team of digital marketing professionals and understand the role of Paid Social for Sephora by working with best in class media experts
Develop a solid understanding of Digital Marketing and Media

We’re Excited About You If You Have
Have an interest in learning how to be a more inclusive leader and ally.
Demonstrated leadership skills as evidenced by involvement in organizations, community involvement, sports, and other activities.
Currently working on completion of Bachelor’s degree in related field in Business, Analytics, Marketing, or Communications and is currently a junior or senior in credit hours
Data-driven mindset with the ability to gather insights and draw conclusions
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work well in a fast-paced team environment
Innate sense of intellectual curiosity that drives you to be constantly learning
Taking initiative in problem solving and out of the box thinking
Adaptable to a variety of tasks and projects
Positive attitude - eager to get involved in projects

You’ll Love Working Here Because
The manifesto. Sephora believes in championing all beauty, living with courage, and standing fearlessly together to celebrate our differences. We will never stop building a community where diversity is expected, self-expression is honored, all are welcomed, and you are included. We belong to something beautiful.
The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams - people you can be proud to work with.
The product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product (“gratis”) various times throughout the year. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)
The business. It feels good to win - and Sephora is a leader in the retail industry, defining experiential retail with a digital focus and creating the most loved beauty community in the world…with the awards and accolades to back it up.
The perks. Sephora offers comprehensive medical benefits, generous vacation/holiday time off, commuter benefits, and “Summer Fridays” (half-days every Friday between Memorial and Labor Day)…and so much more.
The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Marc Jacobs, and Dior.

Working at Sephora’s Field Support Center (FSC)

Our North American operations are based in the heart of San Francisco’s Financial District, but you won’t hear us call it a headquarters - it’s the Field Support Center (FSC). At the FSC, we support our stores in providing the best possible experience for every client. Dedicated teams cater to our client’s every need by creating covetable assortments, curated content, compelling storytelling, smart strategy, skillful analysis, expert training, and more. It takes a lot of curious and confident individuals, disrupting the status quo and taking chances. The pace is fast, the fun is furious, and the passion is real. We never rest on our laurels. Our motto? If it’s not broken, fix it.

Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

Company Overview

SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

title: 2021 Remote Marketing Intern
requirements:
Founded in 1995, Insight Partners is a leading global venture capital and private equity firm investing in market-leading software ScaleUp companies. Some of these companies include Pluralsight, Qualtrics, Smartsheet, Alteryx, Yext, Trivago, HelloFresh, and Docusign. Insight has invested in more than 400 companies and has raised through a series of funds more than $30 billion in capital commitments. With 25 years of investment experience, our mission is to partner with enterprise-ready software companies that have proven business models and product-market fit, to accelerate growth for long term success.

Having completed 200+ portfolio led acquisitions, 100+ strategic exits, and more than 45 IPOs, Insight is the leading ScaleUp software investor. It engages in both majority and minority investments and purchases both primary and secondary shares. Insight’s focus on growth provides the financial flexibility to pursue investments such as growth equity, capital for M&A, PE buyouts, take-privates, pre-IPO rounds, and recapitalizations. Insight has been recognized by several awards and rankings including the Forbes Midas List, Fortune's list of top-performing 20 funds, and the Private Equity International Awards.

Insight’s ScaleUp division, Insight Onsite, partners with Insight’s portfolio companies to build formidable software businesses. Onsite is comprised of 50+ operational experts with experience working at ScaleUp software companies, who have the shared goal to help portfolio companies define their business strategy, build their teams, and improve their operations as they scale. Onsite is organized via 6 Centers of Excellence: Talent, Product & Tech, Marketing, Sales & Customer Success, Business Development, and Strategy and M&A, to provide tailored guidance critical to scaling software businesses
